page.title: 04PEOPLE AT WORK ENERGY
page.content:
Apart from those employed in the area in fishing, agriculture, shops and services, people travel outwith the area to work. People travel to Dounreay-a bus is laid on for them (journey time 35-40 mins. by car), and Wick (journey time 15 mins.) There is some seasonal work at John O'Groats, and some people are involved in Bed and Breakfast. To the south of the area Kestrel Marine build pipelines onshore which are lter towed out to oil rigs for transporting crude North Sea oil. The pipes can be built 2 miles long.
{ENERGY} The west of the area is peat land, and many people go out and cut peats for their fires. Most houses have peat stacks outside them. A few week's work in evenings and weekends can provide cheap heat & hot water.
